alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Alachua and northwestern Marion Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 928 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near University Of Florida to Anthony. Movement was northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anthony, Micanopy, Reddick, McIntosh, Flemington and Lowell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua; Western Marion
